title: PSG Rejects Chelsea Transfer Bid for Jennifer Echegini
body_text:
Paris Saint Germain have turned down an approach from Chelsea for Nigeria midfielder Jennifer Echegini as the French champions move to retain one of their key players during the winter transfer window, PUNCH Sports Extra reports.
Chelsea made a late push for the 24-year-old with three days remaining before the English transfer deadline, but PSG were reportedly unwilling to entertain negotiations, prioritising squad stability for the second half of the season.
The Parisian hierarchy consider Echegini central to their sporting project and have no intention of sanctioning her departure midway through the campaign.
Confirming the development, Le Parisien journalist Benjamin Suarez said, “Paris Saint Germain have rejected an offer from Chelsea for Jennifer Echegini, with the French club keen to retain the Nigeria international during the current winter transfer window. The transfer deadline in England closes on 3 February.”
Echegini joined PSG from Juventus in June 2024 on a three-year contract that runs until June 2027, following her development at the Arsenal academy.
Since her arrival in Paris, she has established herself as a key midfield presence, valued for her composure, tempo control and ability to influence decisive moments.
Her growing reputation has also been shaped by her performances for Nigeria.
Echegini scored the winning goal in the 2024 Women’s Africa Cup of Nations final in Morocco, to secure a historic 10th continental title for the Super Falcons.
According to Soccerdona valuations, Transfermarkt’s women football platform, Echegini is currently Africa’s fifth most valuable female footballer and Nigeria’s second most valuable, behind Rasheedat Ajibade at €375,000.
